name: Start
subtitle: Creative Operations: A Guide To Building a Squad and Operate as a Creative Agency.

name: Goal
subtitle: A sentence about the goal of this workshop.

name: Explanation
bodytext: What is creative operations and why should we care about how we work. And how we can manage others work too. Write something about squads. Where can this come from and why it is important. Cross polination with a cool graphic.

We are going to get to know your squad and begin to define the value set that will be the driving force for your positive work together. Getting buy-in from all squad members helps to achieve alignment and common ground on what is important to strive for.

steps.bodytext: Seed the conversation. Individually, before getting the team together, gather values from other teams or people and jot down a few notes. Review the sample to get an understanding of what your squad will be making:
Continue individually and come up with at least 10 values that you already practice or believe would be important to practice.
Come together as a squad and share your thoughts with each other. Have each squad member write down 5 values on sticky notes privately, then post them on the wall for discussion.
Let each squad member explain the values they identified.
Group common values on the wall to narrow your options and identify trends.
After discussion, give each squad member 5 votes to cast their votes for the values they feel best represent the squad.
Further discussion may be required to trim the list to the essentials. Once you have a final list, create a shared document with a detailed description of each value.

subtitle: Now it's time to put this into action.
